content:
ed in physics that Newton’s theory was consistent with everyday ex-
perience. The fossil record has nothing to tell us about, say, whether or how
the interactions of 11-cis-retinal with rhodopsin, transducin, and phospho-
diesterase could have developed, step by step.
“How a nerve comes to be sensitive to light hardly concerns us more than
how life itself originated,” said Darwin in the 19th century. But both phe-
nomena have attracted the interest of modern biochemistry in the past few
decades.
